Description: Stamp (vessel): qisṭ. Measure of olive-oil. With five line Kufic inscription. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: See also OA+ 4015. From the same die: Petrie, W.M.F. 1926. ‘Glass stamps and weights’. London, 107; Viré, F. 1956. Dénéraux, estampilles et poids musulmans en verre en Tunisie (Collection H.H. Abdul Wahhab). ‘Cahiers de Tunisie’ IV, 4.

As in the case of the quarter- qisṭ denomination (see OA+ 4018 and OA+ 4286) there is a second die very similar to the one represented in the present collection. The two can be distinguished by the final bāʾ of al-Ḥabḥāb and other letters. The illustrated examples are Miles 1958, 35 and Balog 1976, 98. The specimens that have not been illustrated may be from either die. (Casanova 1893, 108; Viré, 5; Launois 1957, 40.) Bibliography: Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York; Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III, 1-83. Miles, G.C. 1958. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ I. New York; Casanova, P. 1893. Catalogue des pièces de verre des époques byzantine et arabe de la collection Fouquet. ‘Mémoires publicées par les membres de la Mission Archéologique Francaise au Caire’ VI. Paris; Viré, F. 1956. Dénéraux, estampilles et poids musulmans en verre en Tunisie (Collection H.H. Abdul Wahhab). ‘Cahiers de Tunisie’ IV, 17-90.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (61)
